website_summaries.verdict: Core knowledge lesson guidance prepared by an education scholar.
pros: Appropriate for homeschool and public school situations
A research-based reference book for anyone guiding a Kindergartener through the standards
cons: Some readers say it's less of a curriculum and more of a guide, which means that supplementary materials may be needed

customer_reviews.title: A must for homeschooling first timers.
customer_reviews.text: This book has saved my sanity when trying to figure out what my child needs to know for her upcoming kindergarten year. We are homeschooling due to the pandemic and this book is the single best thing I’ve bought to help guide us through common core. Includes all language arts stories, fables, and poems. Also has fun science experiments, history readings, music, art, math and tons of parent guidance throughout. It’s a must for parents who are feeling overwhelmed by all of the mess going on right now in the education system.
customer_reviews.author: M.H.

customer_reviews.title: A helpful reference.
customer_reviews.text: This book is quite helpful as a beginning homeschooler. I wish I'd bought it at the beginning of the year, but luckily I'd covered plenty of the things in it already. I'll definitely be buying one for first grade! I like that the stories and fables are included, rather than just a list too hunt down elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Ali A.

customer_reviews.title: Book falling apart
customer_reviews.text: Good information on language/literature, history/geography, art, music, math and science. I would've given 4 stars, however, the book is falling apart, very disappointing. I purchased the book from Amazon about seven months ago.
customer_reviews.author: Leticia Escalante-Reyes

customer_reviews.title: I felt like I needed to have a standardized list of all ...
customer_reviews.text: This was helpful starting out, I felt like I needed to have a standardized list of all that I needed my kiddos to know for homeschooling. This was helpful in getting that list, but it's also quite tedious feeling. I'm trying to find something a bit more balanced.
customer_reviews.author: Rory L Bogan

customer_reviews.title: This book is great. We use it as a guide for our ...
customer_reviews.text: This book is great. We use it as a guide for our homeschool cirriculum. The book introduces each topic very well, and we expand on those topics with materials from other sources. I am so glad I purchased What Your Kindergartener Needs to Know to help me plan my homeschool year. My daughter loves having her own little "textbook" to learn from. I recommend this to anyone interested in making sure their child's education is the best.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: Broad in scope, but condensed into a digestible format. Really enjoyed reading the literature chapter with my kiddo; included some of the classic stories that we may have otherwise missed. Geography & history were well thought out, just enough info to give the basics but not too much to overwhelm. I would absolutely recommend; not as an entire curriculum but rather as a complementary resource. We used it for “summer school” at home in preparation for Kindergarten.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Not what I was hoping for
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was going to be more like a teaching manual. But it's mainly just full of nursery rhymes
customer_reviews.author: Miss.

customer_reviews.title: This is core knowledge.. ..
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this book. It has most everything a child would need to know to move on to first grade. However, something is necessary to make this complete. It needs a companion workbook, or at least a better question and answer review or synopsis at the end of each section. Having one or the other would greatly enhance a child's education. One tip I did discover the hard way -- definitely buy the paperback and NOT the Kindle version. We did start with the Kindle, but having the hard copy makes a world of difference for highlighting, taking notes, and reviewing chapters. Plus a 'Good' to 'Like New' one is cheaper than the eversion.
customer_reviews.author: AMcho

customer_reviews.title: A rich curriculum for every grade level.
customer_reviews.text: Core knowledge is almost the opposite of common core. Instead of dumbing down your kids, it teaches them important concepts appropriate to their age on which they can build more knowledge. Don’t confuse this enriching curricula with the nonsense kids are getting from common core. Great for home schoolers as well as supplements for school children.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. C.F. Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected. It's a very wordy book ...
customer_reviews.text: Not what I expected. It's a very wordy book with not much of a list of expected know how's.
customer_reviews.author: L.Family

customer_reviews.title: Guide to Kindergarten
customer_reviews.text: I love this series of books and recommend them to all parents. I use them to review concepts with my own children to ensure that they have the basic understand of concepts needed for their grade level. I often review with them over the summer. In addition, it has many things that are overlooked during the school day as a teacher only has so much time. I particularly appreciate the fine arts, cultural literacy, and geography sections of these books. This book is not a complete curriculum but rather an overview of the minimum amount of knowledge your child should have at each grade level.
customer_reviews.author: Alivia

customer_reviews.title: good ideas
customer_reviews.text: this book is great, especially now with the covid, we all need help starting the little guys
customer_reviews.author: crystal

customer_reviews.title: Perfect prep for Kindergarten.
customer_reviews.text: My son is a little ahead of his class, so his teacher recommended this book so we could help him learn what she planned on teaching this year. This book is amazing. Like the title says it really covers EVERYTHING a Kindergartner needs to know and suggests other books that go more in-depth on certain subjects. It covers reading, writing, literature, history, geography, visual arts, music, mathematics and science. There are tips on various activities and methods parents can use. I am happy we got this and can now use it for our daughter.
customer_reviews.author: Jacquelyn L. O. Gonsalves

customer_reviews.title: Excellent guide to a kindergartner's education
customer_reviews.text: This series is a great guide to a year's worth of education for kindergartners. We homeschool and these books have helped a lot! I highly recommend to anyone needing guidance on a year's worth of lessons in every subject in one book. It also lists recommended additional reading/lessons. Use these books as a guide for every subject (english, math, history, science, art, music) and add a few workbooks like math and science to make school work easy!
customer_reviews.author: Chocolate

customer_reviews.title: Excellent homeschoolers resource!
customer_reviews.text: Used this series twenty years ago when I homeschooled. They have been updated and I am now happily using this series to homeschool our two grandchildren during the pandemic.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Very good classic stories and fables included, and good basic explanations of history, science, etc. that I'm not convinced my kids are learning in public schools. My kids love paging through this book now and then. It is a good supplement to their education, and creates an awareness of the world around them. A good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Camellia Willowbottom

customer_reviews.title: but great for our preschool
customer_reviews.text: A lot of it was too easy/simple for my Kindergartener, but great for our preschool cirruculum
customer_reviews.author: RLBrown

customer_reviews.title: Solid foundation of your child's education
customer_reviews.text: I bought this book in 2002 after it was recommended at a school meeting. The book helps parents to know what your child needs to know at the end of kindergarten in any US school. It can help parents to make decisions regarding books, day trips, games, and other activities that can complement what your child is already learning at school. Our oldest child is close to start college and we still have our copy of this book.
customer_reviews.author: William Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: This book is full of relevant information and upto date. I highly recommend this book for homeschool or any parent. Im very happy I came across this book.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT book, we love reading in it together
customer_reviews.text: This book has been well loved! While we don't use ALL of it, we've used a nice assortment of the various subjects covered. My daughter and I enjoy curling up with this book and going thru literature, geography, history and something else usually. A well done selection. We've now moved up to getting 1st grade which i expect to be as great.
customer_reviews.author: NS Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Homeschool Help
customer_reviews.text: A great book for homeschool families. It gives clear direction and resources are contained right it the book. I would suggest that homeschool families have this series on their shelves for reference, especially those using a unit study, classical model or unschooling methods. It currently goes up to sixth grade and I believe the authors have plans to continue through twelveth grade.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kindergarten
customer_reviews.text: This book is a great resource for homeschoolers. It wasn't exactly what I thought it was going to be, but It was actually better! It lets you know the things your child should be learning in kindergarten and gives activities for the child to do to go along with each subject. It has quite a few stories,songs, and poems in this book. I think it would be a great book to build a curriculum around.
customer_reviews.author: jnaomi

customer_reviews.title: The pictures are great and the stories and non-fiction parts are intriguing
customer_reviews.text: Quality book. I'm enjoying reading it with my Kindergartener. The pictures are great and the stories and non-fiction parts are intriguing.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie K.

customer_reviews.title: Improving Literacy
customer_reviews.text: I wish the government schools would take a serious look at this series, instead of following the continual "testing" approach to excellence. The schools need to teach content that is linked through the grades to insure that more children become literate. All that is needed to prove this is to interview a typical A-B honoroll highschool graduate, asking questions about History, Literature, Civics, Science, Geography,...etc. Teaching to any test will not improve Literacy.
customer_reviews.author: Pierre C. LeMaster

customer_reviews.title: Excellent resource for my homeschooling curriculum
customer_reviews.text: Excellent resource for my homeschooling curriculum! It has almost everything you need. It even includes age appropriate history lessons!
customer_reviews.author: Carter Family

customer_reviews.title: Excellent book , teally helpful for parents
customer_reviews.text: A really great book that doesn't just give you siggestions but there is a lot of actual material to go over. A must for parents who want to understand what their kids need to know in kindergarten and what os the method to covering all the different areas. I use it almost everyday with my 4 year old.
customer_reviews.author: TheRoyalRep

customer_reviews.title: Great activities and information
customer_reviews.text: Just as described "like new." Delivered sooner than expected. Great activities and information. This book will be perfect to supplement in my kindergarten homeschooler next year.
customer_reviews.author: Klh0060

customer_reviews.title: Great stories
customer_reviews.text: The book is fantastic. The binding.... it did not withstand the hands of a five year old who used it daily.
customer_reviews.author: TargetLover

customer_reviews.title: Great book- my kids and I love this series of ...
customer_reviews.text: Great book- my kids and I love this series of books and I use them at each grade level. Pictures and colors are vibrant and exciting in this latest edition but we like the older editions as well.
customer_reviews.author: MommaCX3 ☀️❤️

customer_reviews.title: There's lots of useful teaching ideas
customer_reviews.text: I used these books when I was teaching. There's lots of useful teaching ideas!
customer_reviews.author: fyrefyghter

customer_reviews.title: The school made us buy his book but we have ...
customer_reviews.text: The school made us buy his book but we have never used it. I have flipped through a few sections and it is well written though.
customer_reviews.author: Misti

customer_reviews.title: A Good Reference
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is home schooled, and this was a great help to me for figuring out roughly where she should be at this age. I have found a couple of good ideas in the book from which to springboard learning opportunities. Will definitely be purchasing "What Your First Grader Needs To Know" as well.
customer_reviews.author: TS

customer_reviews.title: PROBLEM SOLVED
customer_reviews.text: Grandson in the Navy .His family always on the move and changing schools. It was a great gift for my grand daughter in law. She can keep their son current as to what he needs to know regargless of what school he is in.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi B

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A great summary of what a kid should retain once he has finished Kindergarten.
customer_reviews.author: JKP

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy this book! It seems to me you can use this book for many years, not just kindergarten.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina Pitts

customer_reviews.title: Highly, highly recommend for anyone who influences a child.
customer_reviews.text: All of these books are indispensable for parents trying to fill in gaps left by public school education, homeschoolers, or grandparents/others who love grade school kids. Each level (Preschool - Sixth Grade) covers what the student should know at that grade and includes much of the material and wonderful lists in the back for other books, recordings, movies, toys, etc. Lots of ideas of material to sneak into time spent with kids. I have these on my own shelf, have gifted them to my children for my grandkids, often give them to young parents, and blessed school teachers with copies of them, too.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Beaulac

customer_reviews.title: My homeschool guide
customer_reviews.text: I use the Core Knowledge Series "What Your _ Grader Needs to Know" as a guide along with my state's requirements for what my children need to learn to teach my kids each school year. It's a great starting point in what to teach for each subject. I have found it to be essential in our homeschool and use it as a base for teaching and a resource to expound upon. My children love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: wonderful book!
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing book, full of ideas, tips, and set up lessons for you to do with your kiddo. I use it to round out my homeschooling, but I would recommend this to anyone with a 4-5-6 year old, even if they are in public school
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Great book for core knowledge parents
customer_reviews.text: This is a great book for parents whose kids go to Core Knowledge Schools. It has a brief description of core knowledge and then stories and concepts to teach your children. Surprisingly old school nursery rhymes and stories.
customer_reviews.author: Jupiter

customer_reviews.title: I wanted a resource for the variety of information I wanted my kindergartner to know...
customer_reviews.text: And this was it! It was so comprehensive, I felt like it was written for me. Anyone who is looking for a single source for a broad knowledge base for a 5-6 year old, buy this book.
customer_reviews.author: Jenrus

customer_reviews.title: great book
customer_reviews.text: love this book. very informative. haven't finished reading or using it but will certainly continue using until it's done. I would buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Windstorm

customer_reviews.title: Had to buy.
customer_reviews.text: This book is a great resource especially if you're homeschooling. It provided a guideline as to what my child 'should' know at this grade level. Great to have.
customer_reviews.author: Gleeia

customer_reviews.title: What your Kindergartner needs to know
customer_reviews.text: I like this book. Since I had no idea on how to homeschool this book has provided me with great ideas plus the pictures are appealing to my little one. We just started but so far so good. In my opinion if a child will pay attention when you open the book then the writer and editors did a good job. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: CrochetQueen

customer_reviews.title: best Kinder book!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this book!! A friend of mine had it & I borrowed it, but once I started to read it I had to buy one for myself so I could highlight things in it and use it daily!!. I homeschool and this is a great tool to use! I plan to buy it for each year!
customer_reviews.author: crazy5

customer_reviews.title: Great Resource
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this book to see what kinds of things I should be teaching my homeschooled child and it has been a great resource.
customer_reviews.author: Faith Ohlinger

customer_reviews.title: Great book for kids
customer_reviews.text: A great book for my son to learn history, culture, geography etc. from one book.
customer_reviews.author: Md. Mashfiqul Islam

customer_reviews.title: Great Resource
customer_reviews.text: Whether you're a new Kindergarten teacher, or a parent of a youngster, this book is a great reference source. It touches on all subject areas in the common core and includes classic poems, fables, and nursery rhymes which are important cultural literacy.
customer_reviews.author: SCrow

customer_reviews.title: Homeschool group recommended
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping to homeschool but didn't know where to start. This book was recommended to me by some mothers at a homeschool meeting. It really helps with what things I will need to be teaching. So far I like it. I think its going to be very useful.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: This series is good. They are the precursor to common core and ...
customer_reviews.text: This series is good. They are the precursor to common core and what it was supposed to be. Universal knowledge, the things everyone should know. I really like these as a baseline so I know where we are in homeschooling. Are we on target with the "normal standard"? I like knowing that, yes in some areas we are just at the minimum, but at others we are way ahead. It gives suggestions and stories that are classics and teach values and are pop culture references that kids just need to know. Very good, and I recommend highly to anyone wondering if your kids are learning everything they need.
customer_reviews.author: K. Hoyt

customer_reviews.title: Excellent book
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this book so I can understand (in general) what my 4 year old needs to knows before Kindergarden. He currently goes to preschool but like most little kids he is hungry to learn more. I have been extremely happy with the book and its content. I agree with others that some of the stories are graphic and deal with death but it is my understanding that between year 4-6 kids are developing difference between good and evil. There are times that I pre read stories and edit them in mind prior to reading them to him. Overall excellent book and well worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: M. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Parent Resource for Kindergarten
customer_reviews.text: I always find what I need on Amazon.com. The book is great. I use it not only to teach my kindergartner, but my daughter who has a learning disability. This book is a magnificent tool for Parents. The reading has a consitent flow and provides very simple techniques to teach the children. Thank you Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Ginger

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: The "What Your ___ Needs to Know" series are very thorough and educational for kids. It's a great homeschooling aid.
customer_reviews.author: Asahmal

customer_reviews.title: Homeschooling made easy
customer_reviews.text: If you want to homeschool in the easiest style imaginable, this is the book for you. Personally, I would urge a new homeschooling parent to read "Give Your Child a Superior Mind" and do a little research on Froebel's theories, but if you have minimal time to spend, this is THE book for you.
customer_reviews.author: Lou Who

customer_reviews.title: great home library addition
customer_reviews.text: This is very comprehensive. I plan to collect all of them
customer_reviews.author: Robin I.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: loved this book. Just what I was looking for being new to homeschooling.
customer_reviews.author: akilwein

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: used this for my son, now using this for my grand son
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: The Kindle Version Works Great.
customer_reviews.text: The KIndle version works great on my iPad Mini. The art pictures can be tapped and enlarged to fill my screen. The TOC works nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good book on classical education
customer_reviews.text: A really good holistic approach to classical learning..I'm going to use it to design units on the topics for my child. Best thing was the price though!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mabid

customer_reviews.title: This is a great book
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent book. My 2 and 3-year-old daughters enjoy the stories (there are a few they never heard), activities, and songs. The best part is they are having so much fun learning. They cannot wait for the next day's activities. This book may not cover everything a Kindergartener should know. However, it contains so much information it is a great start and a great way to measure if a child is learning what they should when they go to Kindergarten.
customer_reviews.author: KW

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful
customer_reviews.text: Very helpful for home schooling!!! I can't wait to get started! It outlines everything you need to teach your little one and even provides some examples and resources!
customer_reviews.author: Josh Blade

customer_reviews.title: Another great help for Parents and Teachers
customer_reviews.text: Great for teachers, homeschoolers and for kids. The text is colorful and engaging. Instruction for teachers and parents are right in the intro of each section. Comprehensive to core areas your child should know by this level. Don't expect it to be a full curriculum including lesson plans! Rather, this book includes the texts of songs, rhymes, poems and stories. (That's why the kids can enjoy it, too.) As with any curriculum, you - as the teacher or parent - need to supplement with those topics and skills you believe are most important for your child/students to know.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: Great for bedtime reading
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old daughter asks me to read to her out of this every single night. It has so many topics that lead to great discussions. It is amazing that she flips through this book and asks me questions about the pictures. She is asking things about who lives on certain continents and what the people in the paintings are doing. This book helps us have great academic talks.
customer_reviews.author: Renee O Pruitt

customer_reviews.title: Great Start for Homeschooling Kindergartners
customer_reviews.text: This is not an all-inclusive text, as it may appear at first. It does have good suggestions to get you started on the homeschooling path. I feel like it is a bit too sparse for what I want to accomplish with my kindergartner but it was still worth buying just for the information it contains. If you are thinking about homeschooling I would suggest reading this book:
customer_reviews.author: aw28_2

customer_reviews.title: I think it would be good for a public school student as well if parents ...
customer_reviews.text: We are using this as a base for our 5 year old's home school curriculum this year. It's helping me to ensure I'm covering all my bases. We are using the content to supplement what I'm teaching. I think it would be good for a public school student as well if parents wanted to do some study at home that is age appropriate but their updated version is better aligned with common core.
customer_reviews.author: Amy C.

customer_reviews.title: Going to start homeschool my children and will be using ...
customer_reviews.text: Going to start homeschool my children and will be using common knowledge. This book helps to lay the foundation of what students should know at each grade level. The book is full of information to help children learn at an age appropriate level.
customer_reviews.author: S.Flannery

customer_reviews.title: Gives u info
customer_reviews.text: Still reading. Not sure if there are different versions of this book for Kindergarten. This seemed outdated but not really sure.
customer_reviews.author: Ivy

customer_reviews.title: I enjoyed my order, Thank you Amazon!
customer_reviews.text: This is a good supplemental material you can read with your child. Lot of information included, a must-have book in home. Good deal on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I am so pleased with this book, and all the colorful pictures .
customer_reviews.author: Donna Peters

customer_reviews.title: good book
customer_reviews.text: I really have enjoyed this book. I've used it as a basis while writing my own curriculum. It doesn't give ALL that your child needs to know after K but it does give a very good idea of what you need.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Ordered hard cover and reserved soft cover instead.: ...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered hard cover and reserved soft cover instead. :( The math, science, music, history and geography are vary dispaporshinet to the literature section. I think balance in subject mater is important in fostering a healthy strong foundation. It creates context.
customer_reviews.author: Winter Rush Quick

customer_reviews.title: Good addition
customer_reviews.text: I like the overall idea of this book, however the presentation is not consistent. If you are reading it to your child, you will notice that the text refers to things that are on previous pages, like they should be on the page you're reading. So I find myself having to flip back and forth. I do like however, that it covers a wide range of subjects and content. This book is a good addition to existing curriculum that you may be using, but should not be used as a stand-alone curriculum for kindergarten.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Dackiewicz

customer_reviews.title: Kindergarter Needs to Know
customer_reviews.text: The book arrived so very fast! If only I could get into it half as fast! But I will soon.
customer_reviews.author: Alan W Evensen

customer_reviews.title: great book
customer_reviews.text: The poems, history, geography and science is great. My four year old is always interested. The stories are a little bit boring for him, though, because they don't have any pictures, and some of them are pretty long....
customer_reviews.author: Anon Ymous

customer_reviews.title: Not for me.
customer_reviews.text: I kind of liked "what your preschooler needs to know" because it seemed fun and upbeat and had lots of neat stories for kids. I don't like the kindergarten version at all. It's not fun. It's not upbeat. It's drudgery. I bought it as a homeschooler to see what public schoolers were learning...but I wish I hadn't.
customer_reviews.author: Jen-nay

customer_reviews.title: Good book.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great book although we didnt use it. It really has everything you need to teach your child the entire kindergarten year and is great if you can't afford to spend a lot of money on a full program.
customer_reviews.author: Kabrina Cox

customer_reviews.title: Quite outdated but still has some very good ideas and I like that there are several classic ...
customer_reviews.text: Quite outdated but still has some very good ideas and I like that there are several classic stories in it.
customer_reviews.author: JKJAP

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very good book to help parents provide success for their child.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher J Kemnitz

customer_reviews.title: Hard to say how much impact this will have. ...
customer_reviews.text: Hard to say how much impact this will have. Too much government interference in education to know if this will be applicable.
customer_reviews.author: STLKAD

customer_reviews.title: I was very disappointed in this book which was praised by the liberal ...
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed in this book which was praised by the liberal Core Knowledge series. This is one more publication that is working at dumbing down our children. From now on I will order beginning school books for my kindergartner and preschooler through HomeschoolingBooks.com as they give me a selection to try out. Core Knowledge wants you to think they know what's best for your child but as far as I'm concerned it's not what they recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Katharine

customer_reviews.title: Required Reading By School.
customer_reviews.text: Colorful book, easy to read, required to read by school. Minus 1 star, because book has too many pages to read. lol.
customer_reviews.author: JamazonTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had purchased the more current edition instead.
customer_reviews.author: jtwuae

customer_reviews.title: Interesting read
customer_reviews.text: I am looking forward to getting some great tips for my new kindergartner. I plan to use this book to make the most out of this school year.
customer_reviews.author: TALISA M. COHEN

customer_reviews.title: Do the writers really know what an American kindergartner really needs to know?
customer_reviews.text: Got this to help my son get into good studying habits. He's older than his peers yet has trouble with the basic stuff all his friends are already good at. I found the book's contents to be uneven in difficulties, which makes the whole thing frustrating to use, because as a parent I have to decide which exercises are the appropriate ones for a kindergartner, and I'm not qualified to make those decisions, which is why I bought this book to begin with! I also bought two other grade volumes and found the same problem: some exercises are super hard while others are super easy.
customer_reviews.author: Old-and-Wise

customer_reviews.title: "good" conditioned book listed as "like new" condition- dissappointed
customer_reviews.text: The book was listed as "like new" condition, and it was only in "good" condition. There are markings in the book and folded pages. I was dissapointed to not be accurately told the condition of the book.
customer_reviews.author: sarah

customer_reviews.title: Just great for the first grader to review before his first day in first grade.
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for learning, Mr Hirsch. has been of assist for me and my children for at least 20 years, and I have bought books for others as well and pass them on.........Can't say enough about these books......
customer_reviews.author: Diana F. Stoler
